Examined the serialized data in the cookie and identified the serialization format being used (Python's pickle module)
Crafted a malicious serialized object that contained arbitrary code to be executed upon deserialization by the application
Created a Python class with a __reduce__() method that would execute the desired code upon deserialization
Base64-encoded the malicious serialized object and replaced the original serialized data in the cookie with the payload
Refreshed the web page, causing the application to deserialize my malicious payload and execute the code contained within the Exploit class
Exploiting the insecure deserialization vulnerability allowed me to execute arbitrary code on the server and obtain the flag for the Web Exploitation challenge
